intro: Lithospermum bejariense, commonly known as the Bejari rock pepper, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and vibrant red or purple flowers. It produces small, dark-colored berries that contain the seeds. Lithospermum bejariense is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
